item.title: Quick tip: Passing values to a bash script
item.description: This is a very quick post on how you can make a bash script that allows you to provide it values via the command line. Passing values to a bash script uses a 1-based array convention inside the script, that are referenced by prefixing with $ inside the script. This means that if I provide .\dummyscript.sh value1 value2, inside the dummyscript.sh I can retrieve these by referencing their positions: echo $1 + $2 For improved clarity, you could assign them to new variables
